content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

```julia-repl
julia> using Query

julia> import DataFrames: DataFrame

julia> df_cars = DataFrame(model=[fill("VW Golf", 3); fill("Audi A4", 2); "BMW X5"])
4×1 DataFrame
│ Row │ model      │
├─────┼────────────┤
│ 1   │ VW Golf    │
│ 2   │ VW Golf    │
│ 3   │ VW Golf    │
│ 4   │ Audi A4    │
⋮
```

Your function should work as follows:

```julia-repl
julia> df_cars |> @groupby(_.model) |> count_model_rows()
3×2 DataFrame
│ Row │ model      │ _  │
├─────┼────────────┼────┤
│ 1   │ Audi A4    │ 2  │
│ 2   │ BMW X5     │ 1  │
│ 3   │ VW Golf    │ 3  │
```
